bio: The latest news, rumors and predictions of the NFL. Follow @NFLChase on twitter. —Direct Message me for business inquiries.

posts.description:
UPDATE: According to reports, Former Titans RB DeMarco Murray is continuing his visit with the Miami Dolphins today.
Murray’s visit with Dolphins’ officials has reportedly gone well and it could lead to them finalizing a deal before he leaves Miami.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

TRADE🚨: The Eagles and Panthers have agreed to a trade that will send CB Daryl Worley to Philadelphia, in exchange for WR Torrey Smith to Carolina.
Smith, 29, is set to enter the second year of his 3-year/$15M contract and stands to make a base salary of $5M for the 2018 season.
Smith appeared in all 16 games (14 starts) and caught 36 passes for 430 yards and two touchdowns this season.
Worley, 23, is set to enter the third year of his 4-year/$3.27M contact and is due a base salary of $650K for the upcoming season.
Worley appeared in 15 games (14 starts) and recorded 63 total tackles, two interceptions, and 10 pass defenses this season.
________________________________________________________

Terrelle Pryor is officially a member of the New York Jets.
Pryor, 28, lost significant playing time to Josh Doctson and appeared in just nine games (two starts). In his limited playing time, Pryor hauled in 20 receptions for 240 yards and one touchdown.
Pryor is not long removed from a 2016 season where he caught 77 passes for 1,007 yards and four touchdowns with the Cleveland Browns.

Stay tuned for contract details.

UPDATE: According to reports, Bills OG Richie Incognito is “strongly considering” retirement.
Incognito, 34, hasn’t ruled out the possibility of returning for another season, but it would have to be at the “right price”. Incognito announced via Twitter a few days ago that he was firing his agents, so something was clearly up.

Incognito agreed to a $2.675M pay cut with the Bills last month, which reduced his base salary from $6.325M to $3.65M. Incognito received a $1 million bonus as part of the agreement and it created $1.675M in cap space for the Bills.

However, it appears he’s changed his mind about playing for his reduced salary and is now considering retirement once again.
In 2017, Incognito started all 16 games at left guard for the Bills.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, Eagles DE Michael Bennett has been taken into custody in Harris County, Texas, on an assault charge.
Judge Johnson has set Bennett’s bond at $10K and also issued a “non-contact” order.
According to Miya Shay of ABC 13 in Houston, Bennett is expected to post the $10,000 bond.
Bennett is being charged for assaulting a 66-year-old paraplegic security staffer at Super Bowl LI.
Bennett, 32, could face up to 10 years in prison and a $10,000 fine as a result of his indictment.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

This Just In: According to reports, the Los Angeles Rams plan to trade or release WR Tavon Austin before the start of the new league year.
Austin, 27, signed a 4-year/$42M contract extension ($28.5M guaranteed) in August of 2016 and is set to make a base salary of $3M for the 2018 season. In addition, Austin is due a roster bonus of $5M by the third day of the new league year, March 16th.
The Rams can save $3M by releasing Austin, while absorbing $5M of dead money. If the Rams trade Austin, they would save $8M of cap space, while taking on $0 in dead money.
Austin appeared in all 16 games (9 starts) and hauled in 13 receptions for 47 yards to go along with 270 rushing yards on 59 carries and one touchdown.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Pittsburgh Steelers are hosting free-agent ST ace Matthew Slater for a visit today.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the New York Giants and Buffalo Bills are believed to have a blueprint of a trade sorted out involving the No. 2 overall pick.
Bills’ GM Brandon Beane has been working the phones in attempt to obtain a pick somewhere in the top-5 and there is growing belief that a deal with the Giants is already in place.
However, the Giants will continue to listen to other trade offers leading up to draft night, before accepting the Bills’ proposed offer. There is also a belief among many that the Giants will wait to strike a potential deal until they are officially on the clock to evaluate their options before parting with the pick.
The Bills acquired the No. 12 overall pick from Cincinnati in a trade that sent LT Cordy Glenn and their 21st overall pick to the Bengals. That move was strategically done to give Buffalo the best chance to land a quarterback in the top of the draft with their two first-round picks (No. 12, No. 22) as ammo to move up. In addition, the Bills also possess the No. 53 and 56 picks in the second round and picks No. 65 and 96 in the third round.
Stay tuned for more.
_______________________________________________________

News Release: The Arizona Cardinals officially announced they released RB Adrian Peterson.
Peterson, 32, was due a $750K roster bonus by the third day of the new league year.
Peterson appeared in 10 total games (seven starts) for the New Orleans Saints and Cardinals and rushed for 529 yards on 156 carries (3.4 YPC) and two touchdowns. Peterson also caught 11 passes for 70 yards.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the Dallas Cowboys officially signed Former Jaguars WR Allen Hurns to a 2-year deal worth $12M.
Hurns, 26, appeared in 10 games this past season (8 starts) and caught 39 passes for 484 yards and two touchdowns.
Stay tuned for more.
_______________________________________________________

This Just In: According to reports, the Chicago Bears announced they released OLB Pernell McPhee and S Quentin Demps.
McPhee, 29, was set to enter the fourth year of his 5-year/$38.75M contract and was due to make a base salary of $7.2M for the upcoming season.
Demps, 32, signed a three-year/$13.5M contract with the Bears last offseason and was set to make a base salary of $3M for the 2018 season.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the San Francisco 49ers signed WR Marquise Goodwin to a 3-year/$20.3M contract extension, worth $10M guaranteed.

Goodwin caught 56 passes for 962 yards and two touchdowns this season.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Miami Dolphins re-signed ERFA DB Jordan Lucas.
Lucas, 24, started the 2017 season on the practice squad, but was promoted to the active roster in October and spent the rest of the year there.
Lucas appeared in 12 games this past season and recorded six tackles.
________________________________________________________
Soon-to-be-

UPDATE: According to reports, the Miami Dolphins could still look to trade WR Jarvis Landry, despite placing the franchise tag on him today.
Many league’s executives believe the Dolphins’ quick decision to place the franchise tag on Landry indicates that they are indeed willing to trade him for the right price.
The Dolphins are believed to be sending a message to the league that they are willing to field trade offers for Landry, but they’d have to be enticing enough to be considered.
Landry, 25, is set to make a base salary of $16M under the non-exclusive franchise tag for the 2018 season and there doesn’t appear to be any movement in his contract negotiations with the team.
While the Dolphins have not confirmed that they are open to dealing Landry this offseason, many league executives believe they are open for business.
Stay tuned for more. ________________________________________________________

NFL News: Impending free-agent QB Josh McCown says he is interested in re-signing with the New York Jets even if they select a quarterback in the first-round of the upcoming 2018 NFL Draft.
_______________________________________________________ “It’s hard to say, ‘Hey, I want to go somewhere else’ after you had the best year of your career,” McCown said, via the New York Post. “I liked being there and loved the organization and the guys in the locker room. I think there was a good foundation laid, something special and something that can be built. I understand and respect the evaluation process that has to take place and let’s see where that leads us. Who knows?” McCown added that he’d have no issues returning, even if the Jets used their first-round pick on a quarterback prospect. “I know we have older quarterbacks around the league who are pushing the envelope, but the reality is none of us are going to play forever and you understand that. I’ve said it from Day 1, I really root for these guys being able to find that long-term answer at quarterback and want them to succeed,” McCown said. “If that’s through the draft or that’s through people already on the team if I can be a part of helping that, I’d love to.” _______________________________________________________
In 13 starts this season, McCown, 38, threw for 2,926 yards, 18 touchdowns and nine interceptions to go along with a career-high 67.3 completion percentage.
________________________________________________________

Twitter Poll🚨- Super Bowl 52: Over/Under

Go checkout @nflchase on twitter to cast your vote.
Post your response below⬇️ ________________________________________________________

This Just In: According to reports, the Kansas City Chiefs released OLB Tamba Hali.
Hali, 34, was set to enter the final year of his 3-year/$21M contract and was due a base salary of $5.75M for the 2018 season.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the Houston Texans have expressed “serious interest” in Former Cardinals S Tyrann Mathieu.
No visits have been scheduled as of yet, but Mathieu is expecting to have a strong market.
The New York Giants are another team to watch in the Mathieu sweepstakes.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the Washington Redskins and QB Alex Smith have agreed to a 4-year contract extension that will keep him under contract through the 2022 season.
Smith’s new deal will pay him $23.5M per year in new money and he will receive $70M fully guaranteed.

TRADE DETAILS🚨: The Kansas City Chiefs will receive a 2018 third-round pick in the trade. Kansas City is also expected to receive a player to be named tomorrow in the deal.
Smith, 33, was set to play out the final year of his 4-year/$68M contract he had signed with the Chiefs, but will now be under contract with the Redskins for the next five seasons.
The terms of Smith’s contract extension will not be available until March 14th, when the trade becomes official.
Smith, 33, threw for 4,042 yards, 26 touchdowns, and 5 interceptions in 15 starts this season.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Arizona Cardinals re-signed LB Josh Bynes to a multi-year deal.
Stay tuned for contract details.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, Former Broncos RB C.J. Anderson is not expected to sign with a new team until after the NFL Draft.
The Broncos released Anderson on April 16th, which ended his five year stint in Denver. Since then, Anderson has reportedly garnered interest from at least eight teams, including the Miami Dolphins, who have been linked to him for quite some time.
With that being said, Anderson’s suitors will not offer him a contract until after the draft, which could limit his opportunities if they fill their need at the position over the weekend.
Anderson, 27, was entering the third year of his 4-year/$16.5M contract and was set to make a base salary of $4.5M over the final two years of the agreement.
In 2017, Anderson started all 16 games for the Broncos and rushed for 1,007 yards on 245 carries (4.1 YPC) to go along with 28 receptions for 224 yards receiving and four total touchdowns.

Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the New England Patriots are hosting free-agents WR Jordan Matthews and TE Troy Niklas for visits today.
Matthews, 25, appeared in 10 games for the Bills past season and caught 25 passes for 282 yards and one touchdown.
Niklas, 25, appeared in 15 games for the Cardinals this past season and caught 11 passes for 132 yards and one touchdown.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: Seahawks CB Richard Sherman expects to make a full recovery from his torn Achilles for the 2018 season and anticipates returning to Seattle.
Here’s what Sherman had to say when asked about if he had any doubt in returning from his injury next season: "Not in my mind," he said, according to the Seattle Times' Bob Condotta.
Sherman was also clear that he doesn't believe the injury will alter the way Seattle's front office approaches potential contract negotiations during the offseason. "Honestly, I'm not sure [if it changes anything] on their side of things," he said. "It doesn't change anything in my mind. If we have the talks, we do. If we don't, it is what it is." Sherman, 29, is entering the final year of his 4-year/$56M contract and is set to make a base salary of $13.2M for the 2018 season.
Sherman appeared in nine games for the Seahawks this season and recorded 25 tackles, two interceptions, seven pass defenses and one fumble recovery.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, Matt Eberflus is expected to remain the Indianapolis Colts’ defensive coordinator, despite Josh McDaniels’ decision to return to New England.
Eberflus has reportedly been in the Colts’ building and has already signed his contract to become their defensive coordinator.
Unless the Colts let him out of his contract, Eberflus will stay on their staff regardless of who they hire as their next head coach.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Buffalo Bills waived DE Cap Capi.
Capi, 25, appeared in eight total games for the Giants and Bills this past season and recorded five tackles, one sack and one forced fumble.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: The NFL is expected to pass a rule change that would permit non-playoff teams to hire coaches before the end of the postseason.
The current rule does not allow teams to hire coaches that are involved in the NFL playoffs and it’s something the league is looking to change this offseason.
Earlier this month, the Indianapolis Colts missed out on hiring Patriots OC Josh McDaniels as their next head coach, despite reaching a prior agreement on a deal. In result, it left the Colts scrambling to find a new head coach after the coaching market had already dried up.
Stay tuned for more. ________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Chicago Bears are expected to have “real interest” in Chiefs impending free-agent WR Albert Wilson.
Bears HC Matt Nagy has obvious ties to Wilson from his time as the Chiefs’ offensive coordinator and he is reportedly intrigued by the idea of signing him.
Wilson, 25, signed a one-year/$1.797M contract with the Chiefs last offseason and is now set to hit the open market as an unrestricted free-agent.
Wilson joined SiriusXM NFL radio last week and mentioned that he has no idea how the Chiefs feel about bringing him back, which has opened the door for him to test his value in free agency.
Wilson appeared in 13 games this season (7 starts) and caught 42 passes for 554 yards and three touchdowns.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the San Francisco 49ers re-worked LT Joe Staley’s contract for the 2018 and 2019 seasons.
Staley, 33, was due to make $11M combined over the next two seasons, but will now collect a total of $17.4M. In addition, he’ll make a base salary of $8.72M for the 2018 season as opposed to his initial pay of $5.5M.
The 49ers reward their 6-time Pro-Bowl offensive tackle with a raise that’ll cover the final two years of his contract.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, Raiders OLB Aldon Smith has checked into rehab following a domestic violence incident involving his fiancée.
The victim’s parents reportedly convinced Smith to check into rehab in the wake of the incident.
This comes one day after San Francisco police encouraged the public to help them locate Smith for questioning regarding the alleged domestic violence dispute.
Smith’s fiancée says she is relieved that he is getting the help he needs: “I can tell you this … Aldon called my parents and asked them to take him to rehab,” Smith’s fiancee tells TMZ. “He complied. They went and got him. I was not there. My family took him and had him checked in.” “I wish the BEST for Aldon. And I’m scared for his life with his addiction. I cannot comment on the altercation but I can tell you I love him and so happy he turned to my family who considers him family and hopefully he gets the help he truly needs.” Smith, 28, has not played the last two seasons due to lingering suspensions from substance abuse violations.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, Free-agent OG Justin Pugh is considering an offer from the Arizona Cardinals, but is receiving interest from the Indianapolis Colts.
The Cardinals hosted Pugh for a visit on Thursday and now have competition to sign the 27-year-old guard.
The Colts are working to schedule a visit for Pugh this weekend and could do so in the coming days.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the New England Patriots are hosting free-agent RB Orleans Darkwa for a visit today.
In 2017, Darkwa, 26, appeared in 15 games for the Giants and rushed for 751 yards on 171 carries (4.4 YPC) to go along with 19 receptions for 116 yards receiving and five total touchdowns.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

This Just In: According to reports, the Oakland Raiders are re-signing TE Lee Smith.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Denver Broncos will still aggressively pursue Redskins impending free-agent QB Kirk Cousins in free agency.
The New York Jets have expressed strong interest in Cousins and are reportedly willing to break the bank to secure his commitment to sign. However, the Broncos are well aware of that and will make the necessary moves to extend a competitive offer to Cousins. While the Broncos don’t have nearly as much cap space as the Jets, they won’t let it hinder their pursuit of Cousins on the open market.
Cousins, 29, is also expected to receive interest from the Cleveland Browns, Arizona Cardinals, and Minnesota Vikings.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

Breaking News: According to reports, the Chicago Bears are matching the Green Bay Packers’ offer to retain CB Kyle Fuller.
Fuller is returning to Chicago on a 4-year/$56M deal, worth $18M guaranteed.

Fuller, 26, appeared in all 16 games for the Bears this past season and recorded 68 total tackles, two interceptions, and 22 pass defenses.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the Denver Broncos are exploring a potential trade up with the New York Giants involving the No. 2 overall pick.
The Broncos would potentially trade up to select USC QB Sam Darnold if he is available.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Denver Broncos re-signed RFA OLB Shaquil Barrett to his one-year tender.
Denver placed a second-round tender on Barrett worth $2.194M for the 2018 season.

Barrett, 25, appeared in all 16 games for the Broncos (9 starts) and recorded 37 tackles, four sacks, two forced fumbles, and a recovery.

________________________________________________________

UPDATE: Contract Details- The Carolina Panthers officially signed Former Bills S Da’Norris Searcy to a 2-year deal worth $5.7M.
Searcy can make up to $3.1M in the first year of his deal.
Searcy, 29, appeared in all 16 games for the Titans this past season (6 starts) and recorded 26 total tackles, one interception, and two pass defenses.

________________________________________________________

Breaking News: The Bengals and Bills have agreed to a trade that will send LT Cordy Glenn to Cincinnati.
Glenn, 28, is set to enter the third of year of his 5-year/$60M contract ($36M guaranteed) and stands to make a base salary of $9.250M for the 2018 season. Glenn is also set to carry a $14.450M cap hit on the team’s payroll.
In 2017, Glenn only played in six games before being placed on I.R. with foot and ankle injuries.
The Bills will free up $4.850M in cap space by trading Glenn, while taking on $9.6M of dead money.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the New York Jets and Vikings impending free-agent QB Teddy Bridgewater are finalizing a deal.
Stay tuned for contract details.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the New Orleans Saints and QB Drew Brees have made significant progress on a two-year contract extension.
No deal is imminent, but both sides expect it to get done before their March 14th deadline.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Washington Redskins waived QB Stephen Morris.
Morris, 25, went undrafted out of Miami in May of 2014 and has spent time with the Jacksonville Jaguars, Philadelphia Eagles, and Indianapolis Colts.
The Redskins had signed Morris to a futures/reserve contract in January.
Morris has yet to appear in an NFL game.
________________________________________________________

Chiefs S Eric Berry is making positive strides in his recovery from a ruptured Achilles.
Berry, 29, suffered the injury in Week 1 vs. Patriots and underwent season-ending surgery.
Berry is set to enter the second year of his 6-year/$78M deal and stands to make a base salary of $8.9M for the 2018 season.

________________________________________________________
Eagles owner Jeffrey Lurie to Carson Wentz: “The best is yet to come.”

TRADE: The Buffalo Bills have acquired the No. 7 overall pick from the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
The Bills are sending the Buccaneers two second-round picks and No. 12 to move up.
________________________________________________________

Injury News: Vikings S Andrew Sendejo is doubtful to return with a calf injury.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Kansas City Chiefs and Houston Texans have expressed interest in Panthers impending free-agent DT Star Lotulelei.
The Panthers have given every indication that they will allow Lotulelei to test the open market and if that’s truly the case, the Chiefs and Texans will be in the mix to sign him.
Lotulelei, 28, played out his 2017 fifth-year option and is set to become an unrestricted free-agent.
Lotulelei started all 16 games this season and recorded 25 total tackles, 1.5 sacks, one fumble recovery, and one pass defensed.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the Dallas Cowboys signed Former Bills WR Deonte Thompson to a 1-year/$2.5M deal.
Thomson will also receive a $1M signing bonus.
Thompson, 29, appeared in all 16 games with the Chicago Bears and Bills (10 starts) and caught 38 passes for 555 yards and two touchdowns.
________________________________________________________

2018 NFL Draft: According to reports, Ohio State C Billy Price (Torn Pec) has informed teams that he will be cleared for the start of training camp in late-July.
Price’s surgeon provided a statement for all NFL teams to confirm the report.
Price (6’4”, 305 lbs) suffered a partially torn pectoral muscle during the bench press drill at the scouting combine in Indianapolis.
He is projected to be a late-first/early-second round pick.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: Impending free-agent CB Rashaan Melvin says the Indianapolis Colts have expressed interest in re-signing him.
_______________________________________________________ “I’m waiting to see exactly where we (him & the Colts) stand. I know it’s all positive,” said Melvin, via SiriusXM NFL Radio. “They told me they want me to be back. That’s where my career blossomed so I wouldn’t mind going back there.. there’s a lot of potential there.” Melvin, 28, played out the final year of his 2-year/$1.45M contract and is set to hit the open market as an unrestricted free-agent next month.
Melvin appeared in 10 games this season and recorded 36 tackles, three interceptions, and 13 pass defenses before landing on the Injured Reserve with a hand injury.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

Cardinals All-Pro RB David Johnson believes they will have the best offense with Sam Bradford under center. “We’re going to be great if Sam Bradford is healthy,” Johnson said. “For me watching him personally I’ve seen him do some great things. I think the biggest thing is just being healthy. Not just with the addition of him, but also the lineman we got, the receivers, and everyone else that we have added to the team on the offensive side, we definitely will be the top offense in the league this year.” The Cardinals signed Bradford to a 1-year deal worth $20M in free agency, but he’s consistently struggled to stay healthy.
Bradford, 30, has played a full season twice since entering the league in 2010. He was limited to just two starts this past season due to a lingering knee injury and was placed on I.R. following a knee scope in early November. He ended up with 382 yards passing and three touchdowns to go along with a 74.4 completion percentage.
In 2016, Bradford started 15 games for the Vikings and threw for 3,887 yards to go along with 20 touchdowns and five interceptions. His 71.6 completion percentage set a single season NFL record, passing Drew Brees’ 2011 mark of 71.2. Brees later finished the 2017 season with a 72.0 completion percentage, reclaiming the record. Bradford’s 395 completions set a Vikings’ franchise record for completions in a season.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: Cowboys VP Stephen Jones says they will put forth a strong effort to re-sign impending free-agent LB Anthony Hitchens.
_______________________________________________________ “That’s going to be one we certainly don’t want to get out of here,” Jones said of Hitchens, via David Moore of the Dallas Morning News. “But we certainly have to understand this is one big puzzle that we have to put together.” Jones explained that while Hitchens may not get a lot of attention, he’s established himself as a leader on their defense and the “type of guy you want on your football team.” “First of all, Anthony Hitchens, I can’t say enough good things about him,” Jones said. “He’s one of those guys who is available. You can count on him. He understands this game is a tough game. He put himself in harm’s way out there when a lot of players wouldn’t do it. He’s the type of guy you want on your football team.” “At the same time, we all know he’s not the ‘quote, unquote’ Pro Bowl football player. He’s not the guy who’s getting all the accolades, but he’s the type of guy you want on your football team so it does make it hard.” Hitchens, 25, is a former 2014 fourth-round pick and is set to become an unrestricted free-agent next month.
Hitchens appeared in 12 games this season and recorded 84 total tackles, a forced fumble, and two pass defenses.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Los Angeles Chargers are hosting free-agent QB Geno Smith for a visit today.
Smith, 27, appeared in two games for the Giants this past season (one start) and threw for 212 yards and one touchdown to go along with a 58.3 completion percentage.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

This Just In: According to reports, the Cleveland Browns released CB Jason McCourty.

McCourty signed a 2-year/$6M deal with the Browns last off-season.
McCourty, 30, started 14 games this past season and logged 65 total tackles, three interceptions with one of them being returned for a touchdown, 14 pass defenses and two forced fumbles.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: Broncos RB C.J. Anderson says he’s focused on proving himself to Denver’s coaching staff, despite an offseason full of trade rumors.
Anderson told Mike Klis of KUSA that he’s moving forward with the knowledge that he “can be traded at any time”, but isn’t letting that stop him from training with a focused mindset. “Just focus on me,” Anderson said. “Use it as motivation. But I’m going to focus on myself. I still have a job. Try to help my team win games. But at the end of the day, getting shopped around or rumors I was getting traded, I’m going to use it as motivation to show the organization I can still play at a high level.” Broncos GM John Elway has confirmed that they are indeed shopping Anderson and is non-committal about his status with the team entering the 2018 season.
In fact, the Broncos and Dolphins agreed to a trade earlier this offseason that would have sent Anderson to Miami, in exchange for OT Ja’Wuan James to Denver. However, the Dolphins reportedly “nixed” the trade at the last minute.
The Broncos can save $4.5M against the cap by trading or releasing Anderson, while absorbing $0 of dead money.
Anderson, 27, is entering the third year of his 4-year/$18M contract and is due a base salary of $4.5M for the upcoming season.
Anderson started all 16 games this past season and rushed for 1,007 yards on 245 carries (4.1 YPC) and three touchdowns. He also caught 28 passes for 224 yards and a touchdown.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the Houston Texans are releasing OT Derek Newton.
The Texans reportedly failed Newton on a physical back on March 23rd, before he was due a $500K roster bonus on April 1st.

Newton sought a second opinion from Dr. James Andrews, who deemed him fit to take part in workouts that are set to open next week.

Newton is expected to file a grievance against the Texans for not paying him the $500K bonus he was owed at the beginning of the month.
Newton, 30, is a former seventh-round pick of the Texans back in 2011. He was entering the third year of his 5-year/$26.5M contract and was set to make a base salary of $2.25M for the 2018 season.

In 2016, Newton started in six games for the Texans before suffering torn patellar tendons in both legs, which ended his season. He sat out the entire 2017 season as he continued to rehab his way back from both injuries.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: Redskins executive Doug Williams says they have yet to speak with S Su’a Cravens about his future with the team.
_______________________________________________________ “That’s something we will have to see,” said Williams, via JP Finlay of NBC Sports.
Williams did not address last week’s report detailing the Redskins’ intention to field trade offers for Cravens.
Cravens, 22, is a former 2016 second-round pick and spent the entire 2017 season on the reserve/left squad list after contemplating retirement.
Cravens was officially reinstated by the league earlier this month.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: Texans impending free-agent CB Johnathan Joseph says re-signing with the Houston Texans is his “first choice.” _______________________________________________________
Here’s what Joseph had to say when asked about his approach to free-agency: “I’m just chilling. We’ll see how it goes,” Joseph said, per Aaron Wilson. “Obviously I want to be here. That’s my first choice. We’ll see how it goes.” Joseph, 33, played out the final year of his 3-year/$22M contract and is slated to become an unrestricted free-agent in March.
Joseph appeared in all 16 games this season and recorded 37 tackles, 2 interceptions with one of them being returned for a touchdown, and 9 pass defenses.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

Breaking News: According to reports, the Miami Dolphins and Former Chiefs WR Albert Wilson have agreed to a 3-year/$24M contract.
Wilson intends to sign the contract when free agency officially opens on Wednesday.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the Carolina Panthers re-signed OG Amini Silatolu to a one-year deal.
Silatolu, 29, appeared in 14 games this past season and played a total of 247 snaps.
________________________________________________________

Breaking: The NFL announced that the 2018 regular season schedule will be released on Thursday, April 19th at 8 p.m. ET on NFL Network.
________________________________________________________

NFL News: According to reports, the New York Jets hosted free-agent DL Frostee Rucker for a visit today.
Rucker, 34, appeared in all 16 games for the Cardinals this past season and recorded 29 tackles, 1.5 sacks and a pass defense.

Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

Injury Update: According to reports, Colts QB Andrew Luck is expected back at the team’s facility this week after rehabbing in Los Angeles.
Luck spent time rehabbing his surgically repaired shoulder with multiple quarterback gurus, including Tom House.
Luck is believed to be making significant progress and anticipates returning for the 2018 season.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

UPDATE: According to reports, the Minnesota Vikings are scheduled to interview Eagles QBs coach John DeFilippo for their offensive coordinator job today.
It was reported that the Vikings had to wait at least ten days after the Super Bowl to interview DeFilippo, but it appears they were able to set up a meeting earlier due to his coaching contract expiring with the Eagles.
Stay tuned for more.
________________________________________________________

This Just In: Former Steelers, Patriots OLB James Harrison has announced his retirement from the NFL.
Harrison, 39, will hang it up after 15 NFL seasons as a member of the Pittsburgh Steelers, Cincinnati Bengals, and New England Patriots. He also had a brief stint with the Baltimore Ravens, but did not play a single game as a member of their team.
Here is the message Harrison posted to his Instagram page: “I’ve missed way too much for way too long...and I’m done. Many thanks to my family, coaches, fans, and everyone who played a role in my football life.”

NFL News: According to reports, Seahawks QB Russell Wilson and his camp recently reached out to GM John Schneider to ask why he attended Wyoming QB Josh Allen’s pro day.
When Schneider attended Allen’s pro day two weeks ago, Wilson and his camp took notice. Mark Rodgers, Wilson’s agent, reached out to Schneider to find out why he made the trip to Laramie, Wyoming to see Allen workout in front of several other teams.

Rodgers asked what it meant for Wilson’s future in Seattle “and if there is anything we need to know.” The other details of their exchange were not disclosed, but one thing is for certain: both sides are gearing up for their looming contract negotiations in 2019.
Wilson, 29, is entering the third year of his 4-year/$87.6M deal and the expectation is that both sides will open contract talks next offseason.
Under Schneider, the Seahawks have always operated with the philosophy of signing their “core players” to extensions with one year remaining on their contracts.
With that being said, the Seahawks know Wilson’s asking price is going to be steep and are also aware of how much higher the quarterback market will climb following the new deals of Packers’ QB Aaron Rodgers and Falcons’ QB Matt Ryan.
The Seahawks are in rebuilding mode and their decisions to move on from veterans such as Richard Sherman, Jimmy Graham, and Michael Bennett reflect their plan to get younger and shed salary. This has led many believe that the 2018 season could be a “make or break” year for the long-term partnership of Wilson and the Seahawks.
Jim Trotter of the NFL Network says Wilson could force his way out of Seattle via trade if they fail to contend in 2018. “If things don’t go well this year, perhaps he (Wilson) says “maybe this isn’t a good fit if this is a rebuilding situation here” and maybe he tries to push the button to move on after that.” Schneider obviously hasn’t been quiet about doing extensive homework on quarterback prospects as he’s reiterated the importance of the position in several interviews with ESPN 710 radio.
The Seahawks currently hold the 18th overall pick of the 2018 NFL Draft.

UPDATE: According to reports, the NFL is set to depose Former 49ers QB Colin Kaepernick today in New York as a part of his ongoing collusion case against the league.
Kaepernick is reportedly the first witness the NFL will depose. With that being said, league officials are likely to focus on his mental outlook once he entered free agency in March of 2017 and whether he corrupted his free-agent market through a series of factors relating to football skills, contract expectations and motivation to play.

Some of the inquiries that are expected to be on the agenda for NFL lawyers, include: -Whether Kaepernick expected to be signed as a starter once he opted out of his contract with the San Francisco 49ers. -What salary demands he or his representation had in mind early in free agency. -Whether Kaepernick’s capacity to play diminished due to past injuries. -How Kaepernick related to coaches or teammates while playing for the 49ers. -Whether Kaepernick expressed a willingness to continue his professional football career anywhere outside of the NFL. -Whether Kaepernick has ever discovered or been presented with tangible proof that NFL teams or executives sought to eliminate him from playing in the league again.

A source familiar with the proceedings says that while this is a significant peak in the collusion case, it doesn’t necessarily mean an end is near and it’s realistic that this could drag well into 2019.

Kaepernick, 30, visited with the Seattle Seahawks last year, but left without a contract agreement. Since then, there hasn’t been any reported interest in him.

In 2016, Kaepernick completed 59.2 percent of his passes for 2,241 yards and 16 touchdowns and four interceptions for the 49ers. He also rushed for 468 yards.
Stay tuned for more.

UPDATE: The Broward County State Attorney’s Office announced that eight of the nine charges against Jets WR Robby Anderson have been dropped.

Once an officer pulled him over, Anderson reportedly threatened to sexually assault the officer’s wife. But now, state prosecutors won’t pursue all the felony charges related to that incident, reducing Robinson’s slate to one for reckless driving and dismissing the other eight charges.
Here is the official statement from the district attorney’s office: "The felony charge was downgraded to a misdemeanor charge due to a possible discrepancy regarding the initial estimated speed, but there is no doubt that the defendant was driving recklessly," the Broward County State Attorney's Office said in a statement. "The other charges were declined, not filed, due to insufficient evidence." Anderson, 24, is entering the final year of his 3-year/$1.630M contract and is due a base salary of $630K for the 2018 season. He will then become a restricted free-agent in 2019.

NFL News: According to reports, the Seattle Seahawks and Dallas Cowboys may re-visit trade talks involving S Earl Thomas during the NFL Draft.
Seattle and Dallas briefly discussed a potential trade involving Thomas earlier this offseason, but their talks did not go far. This was due in large part to the Seahawks’ asking price of first and third-round picks.
However, there is growing belief that both sides will re-open dialogue during the upcoming draft. The Seahawks have been non-committal about retaining Thomas for the 2018 season, despite the All-Pro safety expressing his desire to retire with the organization on social media last month.
Seahawks GM John Schneider along with other teams know that their lofty asking price is not reasonable, considering Thomas’ expiring contract. The Cowboys are well aware of the Seahawks’ interest to acquire a second or third-round pick, simply because they don’t have either at this point in time. After Seattle picks at 18th overall, they will not have another selection until the fourth-round. With that being said, Dallas is expected to offer the Seahawks their second-round pick (No. 50 overall) for Thomas.
Many league executives believe the the Seahawks will eventually accept Dallas’ offer, which will end Thomas’ eight year run in Seattle.
In addition, the Cowboys’ decision to take $8.5M of cap space from Dez Bryant’s release is another indicative factor that they are indeed keeping flexibility to fit Thomas under their payroll for the upcoming season. Dallas could have designated Bryant as a Post-June 1 release, which would have freed up $12.5M against the cap, but their decision to take the immediate cap space provides another clue that this rumor does indeed have validity.
It’s also worth mentioning that a trade will be contingent upon Seattle giving Dallas permission to speak with Thomas’ agent to discuss terms of a potential contract extension.
Thomas, 28, is entering the final year of his 4-year/$40M deal and stands to make a base salary of $8.5M for the 2018 season.
Stay tuned for more.

Injury Update: Colts QB Andrew Luck (shoulder) says he is “very, very optimistic” about his recovery, but has not started throwing a football yet.
Luck says he is not throwing at “full strength” yet, but expressed optimism over the progress he continues to make in his rehab.
Luck had been throwing non-football items during the earlier stages of his rehab, in order to strengthen his surgically repaired shoulder. He will continue to workout with the team as OTAs get underway.
Luck, 28, has not played since 2016, after undergoing surgery on his throwing shoulder to repair a lingering issue that had bothered him since 2015.
Following surgery, Luck was held out of training camp last July and did not receive clearance to play in the preseason. The Colts later announced that he would not be ready for the regular season, which prompted the team to start Scott Tolzien in Week 1.
The Colts then went on to acquire Jacoby Brissett from the New England Patriots and started him for the remainder of the 2017 season.
The Colts later placed Luck on the Injured Reserve on November 2nd, officially ending his season.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: According to reports, the Houston Texans will consider releasing RB Lamar Miller ahead of the new league year.
Miller, 26, signed a 4-year/$26M contract with the Texans in March of 2016, but struggled to consistently produce for the team’s offense this past season.
Miller lost playing time to RB D’Onta Foreman before the former Texas Longhorn standout suffered a torn Achilles in Week 11.
Miller appeared in all 16 games (13 starts) and rushed for 888 yards on 238 carries (3.7 YPC career-low) and three touchdowns. Miller also caught 36 receptions for 327 yards and three touchdowns.
If the Texans release Miller this offseason, they can save $4.75M of cap space while absorbing $2M of dead money.
Miller is set to make base salaries of $5M and $5.5M over the final two years of his contract agreement.

NFL News: According to reports, the Jacksonville Jaguars are “evaluating” the upcoming free-agent quarterback class and could look to part ways with QB Blake Bortles ahead of the new league year.
While the Jaguars may be on the hook to pay Bortles his $19M fully guaranteed salary for the upcoming season, that isn’t stopping them from “actively exploring” impending free-agent quarterbacks.
Bortles underwent wrist surgery after the season and may not be able to pass a physical before March 14th, which would hinder the Jaguars’ pursuit to add another signal caller as his salary would become fully guaranteed.
However, if the Jaguars are able to negotiate a deal with a free-agent quarterback when the legal tampering period begins on March 12th, they could move quickly and look to trade Bortles if he isn’t medically cleared before the new league year. If Bortles is able to pass a physical, the Jaguars would simply release him, which would permit them to get out of the final year of his contract without absorbing any dead money.
Bortles, 25, started all 16 games this season and threw for 3,687 yards, 21 touchdowns, and 13 interceptions to go along with a 60.2 completion percentage. In addition, Bortles rushed for 322 yards on 57 attempts (5.6 YPC) and two touchdowns.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: According to reports, the New York Jets could be willing to offer Redskins impending free-agent QB Kirk Cousins a fully guaranteed contract.
The most recent team to extend a fully guaranteed offer to a player was the Miami Dolphins when they signed DT Ndamukong Suh to a record 6-year/$114.375M contract. The Dolphins fully guaranteed three years of Suh’s deal.
With that being said, many league executives are hearing that the Jets will consider offering up to four years in guaranteed money to Cousins in free agency. In doing so, the Jets would financially separate themselves from all other interested suitors, which could help them land Cousins.
Cousins already views the Jets as a team of interest, considering his high regard for OC Jeremy Bates and his familiarity with Mike Shanahan’s offense.
Here’s what Cousins had to say about his respect for Bates and playing for the Jets in an appearance on “NFL Live” earlier this month: “With the Jets, the first thing that stands out is Jeremy Bates has a connection to coach [Mike] Shanahan,” he said. “Both Mike, Kyle [Shanahan], that whole system I played in. Sean McVay comes from that tree. I just think so highly of them as playcallers, as offensive gurus if you will. Because Jeremy comes from that tree, it would be exciting to think about working with someone like that, knowing how important Xs and Os and game planning is and having the right play caller.” Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: Dolphins VP Mike Tannenbaum is noncommittal about exercising WR DeVante Parker’s 2019 fifth-year option this offseason. “DeVante is another guy we drafted here,” Tannenbaum said this week, via Joe Schad of the Palm Beach Post. “We want to see him reach his potential. I know it’s important to him. Obviously, he’s dealt with injuries, which is I’m sure as frustrating to him as it is to us. We’re going to keep working with him and try to get him to be the best player he can be. Obviously he has a big ceiling and a lot of ability. He works hard at it. Like I said, I think it’s important to him. In terms of where we’ll go with his contract and his option, we have plenty of time to make that decision, so that’s a ways down the road.” “Again, we’ll look at it as the offseason evolves and where that goes,” Tannenbaum said. “Again, we like DeVante as a person. We see his ability and, again, hope that he can grow and develop to reach his potential.” _______________________________________________________
Parker, a former 2015 first-round pick, has battled injuries and has been unable to consistently produce for the Dolphins through three seasons.
Parker got off to a hot start to begin the 2017 season, but he was held to one reception for six yards or less in three games.
In 13 games this season, Parker finished with 57 receptions for 670 yards and 1 touchdown.
Parker, 25, is set to enter the final year of his 4-year/$10.8M rookie deal and stands to make a base salary of $1.91M for the 2018 season.
If the Dolphins do not pick up Parker’s option, he would become an unrestricted free-agent at the end of next season.

Injury Update: Redskins HC Jay Gruden says TE Jordan Reed recently underwent a toe procedure that will keep him sidelined until training camp.

He’s had some procedure done on his toes and now it’s just a matter of the rehab,” Gruden said this week. “He’s been working hard at it. NFL News: According to reports, the Tennessee Titans will consider releasing RB DeMarco Murray this offseason.
The Titans are set to enter the offseason with HC Mike Vrabel at the helm, alongside an entire new staff. This does not bode well Murray’s future in Tennessee, considering his $6.250M salary for the 2018 season.
Derrick Henry has established himself as the lead-back moving forward and the Titans are not entirely inclined to pay a 30-year-old running back such a rich salary to be second in their rotation.
Murray is set to enter the third year of his 4-year/$25.25M contract and is scheduled to make $12.75M against the cap over the final two years of the agreement.
The Titans can save $6.5M of cap space by releasing Murray this offseason, without taking on any dead money.
Murray started 15 games this season and rushed for 659 yards on 184 carries (3.6 YPC) and six touchdowns. In addition, Murray hauled in 39 receptions for 266 yards and one touchdown.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: Cowboys VP Stephen Jones says their “top goal” this offseason will be to sign DE DeMarcus Lawrence to a long-term contract extension.

In 16 starts, Lawrence recorded 58 total tackles, 14.5 sacks (T-2nd in NFL), four forced fumbles, and one pass defense.

NFL News: According to reports, Rams impending free-agent CB Trumaine Johnson is likely to sign with the San Francisco 49ers or Oakland Raiders in free agency.
Johnson, 28, is set to depart the Rams following their acquisition of Marcus Peters, but that doesn’t necessarily mean he’s leaving the state of California.
The 49ers and Raiders are both expected to aggressively pursue Johnson in free agency and are likely to drown out all other interested suitors.
Johnson, a native of Stockton, California, reportedly wants to remain in the “Golden State”, and is not expected to consider other offers unless he is completely blown away.
Johnson appeared in all 16 games (15 starts) and recorded 65 total tackles, two interceptions with one of them being returned for a touchdown, 13 pass defenses, one forced fumble, and one fumble recovery.

NFL News: According to reports, Free-agent RB Tre Mason is attempting an NFL comeback.
Mason, a former 2014 third-round pick of the Rams, has not played football the last two seasons, but he’s now seeking a return.
Mason has reportedly started to reach out to NFL teams to let them know of his desire for another playing opportunity. However, many teams have not expressed interest in him due to his previous off-the-field issues.
Mason had repeated issues with police in 2016 and it ultimately landed him on the Rams’ reserve/did not report list when they opened training camp that summer.
After seeing a lack of progress in his behavior, the Rams released Mason on March 10th, 2017.
Mason, 24, accounted for 972 rush yards on 254 carries (3.8 YPC) and five touchdowns through his first two seasons with the Rams.

NFL News: Free-agent WR Eric Decker says he’s interested in re-signing with the Denver Broncos.
Decker joined 104.3 The Fan for an interview and mentioned that he’s “very receptive” to returning to the Broncos. “Listen, there’s no holdup on my end,” Decker said when asked by Stokley what’s holding up him re-signing with the Broncos. “So whoever you need to call for me, whoever you need to reach out to, please do. Not only is the team one of the greatest organizations in the NFL, but just the community. This is home for us. It’s still a big part of us because, again, we started our lives here, this is where I got drafted, this is where I had both of my kids and gonna have my third kid, so it just means a lot to me. So obviously it’s a desirable place, but again, everything’s got to align, the stars have to kind of align for it to all work. But I’m very receptive to make it happen.” Decker, 31, was selected by the Broncos in the third round of the 2010 NFL Draft and played out his rookie contract, before signing with the New York Jets in 2014.
Decker appeared in all 16 games for the Titans this past season and caught 54 passes for 563 yards and one touchdown.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: According to reports, the Dallas Cowboys have officially moved DB Byron Jones to cornerback.
This was a move that was discussed in the early stages of the offseason and has finally come into fruition under new passing-game coordinator Kris Richard.
Jones, a former 2015 first-round pick, played cornerback for most of his rookie season and did a solid job playing outside and in the slot.
The Cowboys then transitioned him to safety in his second season and played him there up until the 2017 season.
As Jones enters the final year of his 4-year/$8.6M rookie contract, the Cowboys will have to soon decide if they will pick up his 2019 fifth-year option.
Jones, 25, started all 16 games this past season and recorded 82 total tackles, one interception returned for a touchdown, one forced fumble and five pass defenses.

NFL News: Panthers C Ryan Kalil says he plans to retire after the 2018 season.
When asked about his future playing career, Kalil was quick to announce his intentions following the upcoming season: “This is going to be the last one for me,” Kalil said.

Kalil dealt with a serious neck injury last season that limited him to playing in just six games, but he’s looking forward to having a full offseason to rehab and prepare for what will be the final year of his career: “The thing I’m excited about is to actually have an offseason to train because I haven’t had that. I didn’t get that last year and I think that’s part of what contributed to my injury this last season,” Kalil said. “I didn’t get to start training until right around training camp, like actually football training. I just felt way behind and I didn’t feel as physically ready for the season as I would have liked to have been.” Kalil, 32, was drafted in the second round of the 2007 NFL Draft and has spent the last 11 seasons with the Panthers.
Kalil is set to enter the final year of his 2-year/$16.75M contract and stands to make a base salary of $4.5M for the 2018 season.
Kalil is a 5X Pro Bowler (2009-2011, 2013, 2015) and 2X First-team All-Pro (2013, 2015). ________________________________________________________

NFL News: Patriots impending free-agent CB Malcolm Butler says he “definitely” wants to return to New England next season.
Here’s what Butler had to say when asked about his interest in re-signing with the Patriots (NBC Pro Talk): “Most definitely. I want to go out like Kobe,” he said, referencing the star who spent his entire career with the Lakers. “I’m not Kobe, but I want to go out like Kobe.” Butler was nearly traded to the New Orleans Saints last offseason, but negotiations broke down after both sides were unable to agree to a deal.
Butler, 27, ended up signing his one-year/$3.9M restricted tender to return to New England this season, but is now slated to become an unrestricted free-agent in March.
It will be interesting to see how the Patriots find the necessary cap space to sign Butler to a lucrative contract, considering the 5-year/$65M deal they gave Stephon Gilmore last March. The Patriots will have the option to place the franchise tag on Butler as a placeholder until they can work out a long-term deal.
Butler appeared in all 16 games this season (15 starts) and recorded 55 tackles, two interceptions, 12 pass defenses, and three forced fumbles.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: According to reports, the Miami Dolphins have not ruled out the possibility of releasing DT Ndamukong Suh this offseason.
As the Dolphins continue to fix their salary cap situation ahead of the 2018 season, they are reportedly open to parting ways with their high-priced defensive tackle: Ndamukong Suh.
Suh, 31, is set to enter the fourth year of his 6-year/$114.375M contract ($59.95 guaranteed) and stands to make a base salary of $16.985M for the 2018 season season. That is not the entire issue with Suh’s contract.
Suh’s $26.1M cap hit for the upcoming season is the most by any defensive player, the most by any non-quarterback, and third overall behind quarterbacks Jimmy Garoppolo ($37M) and Matthew Stafford ($26.5M). The Dolphins can trade Suh and save $3.9M in cap space and get compensation in return, as opposed to cutting him loose for nothing. However, it will be difficult for the Dolphins to find a trade partner that would be willing to absorb Suh’s contract.
With that being said, Miami can designate Suh as a post-June 1 cut, which would save the team $17M in cap space. This is the most realistic option for the Dolphins if they decide to move on from Suh.
Suh started all 16 games this season and posted 48 total tackles, 4.5 sacks, two forced fumbles, and two pass defenses.
Stay tuned for more.

2018 NFL Draft: According to reports, the Los Angeles Chargers have done “extensive” homework on Louisville QB Lamar Jackson.
Phillip Rivers will be returning for his 15th NFL season, but the Chargers know they need to start searching for his future successor.
The 36-year-old signal caller is entering the third year of his 4-year/$83.25M contract and stands to make base salaries of $10M and $11M over the final two years of the agreement.
With that being said, the Chargers like the idea of drafting a quarterback to sit behind Rivers for a year or two and they’ve identified Jackson as a potential candidate to do just that.
Chargers HC Anthony Lynn has spoken highly of Jackson during the draft process calling him a “nightmare” for opposing defenses.
Chargers OC Ken Whisenhunt was in attendance for Jackson’s pro day at Louisville this morning and met with him following the workout.
The Chargers currently hold the 17th overall pick of April’s draft and could be a potential trade-up candidate, if they decide to go after Jackson in round one.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: According to reports, There is “growing sense” that the Arizona Cardinals will part ways with S Tyrann Mathieu ahead of the new league year.
Cardinals GM Steve Keim and HC Steve Wilks have been noncommittal regarding Mathieu’s future with the team this week due to his inflated cap hit for the upcoming season.
Mathieu, 25, is due $18.75M in guaranteed money if he’s on the Cardinals’ roster by the third day of the new league year and it’s prompting the team’s brass to consider moving on from him.
If Mathieu remains on their roster on March 14th, he’ll have his entire base salary of $5.75M for the 2018 season and $8M of his 2019 salary ($10.750M) fully guaranteed. If Mathieu is on the roster two days later, he’ll collect a $5M roster bonus.
Mathieu is set to enter the second year of his 5-year/$62.5M contract he signed in August of 2016 and is scheduled to have a $14.1M cap hit for the upcoming season.
The Cardinals could approach Mathieu about taking a pay cut or they could look to part ways with the dynamic safety if both sides fail to find common ground.
As of now, there is growing chatter around the combine that the Cardinals are seriously considering trading or releasing Mathieu, which would save $4.8M of cap space. However, Arizona would take on $9.3M of dead money in the process.
Mathieu started all 16 games for the Cardinals this past season and logged 74 total tackles, one sack, two interceptions, one forced fumble, and seven pass defenses.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: According to reports, the Philadelphia Eagles want to promote QBs coach John DeFilippo to offensive coordinator in order to retain him on their staff.
DeFilippo has garnered interest for the Minnesota Vikings’ and New York Giants’ offensive coordinator jobs and it has prompted the Eagles to evaluate options to keep him from leaving.

The Eagles might have their preferred plan in the works as Reich is now being considered for the Indianapolis Colts’ head coaching job. However, if Reich doesn’t get hired by the Colts, it will be interesting to see what approach the Eagles take with DeFilippo.

2018 NFL Draft: The buzz continues to grow in favor of Saquon Barkley becoming a New York Giant.
ESPN Draft analyst Todd McShay says the Giants’ affinity for Barkley is real and believes that he will be the pick at No. 2 overall. “I've heard very strongly that there are important people in the building who believe in Saquon Barkley and being a physical, run-first team,” McShay said. “Barkley can be the face of the team for the next 10 years. It feels inevitable that Saquon Barkley is going to be a NY Giant." The New York Post reported the same sentiment on Sunday, stating that the Giants view Barkley as “a near-perfect prospect”. While smoke-screens are often casted by NFL general managers leading up to draft night, the Giants’ interest in Barkley remains consistent and it’s a certainty that he’ll be hearing his name called very early next Thursday evening.
One other team that has been linked to Barkley during the pre-draft process is the Cleveland Browns with their No. 1 and 4 overall picks. However, Ben Baskin of SI.com reports that Barkley’s agents do not want the Browns to draft their client. They’ve “imported him to pull an Eli Manning” and demand that they not draft him. “His Roc Nation handlers, however, don’t want him to be taken No. 1,” Baskin writes. “They don’t want him in Cleveland. They want him to go second to the Giants and play in the media capital of the world. That’s where you can become the Face of the League. His manager even implored him to pull an Eli Manning and demand that the Browns not draft him. Barkley never considered the option.” Stay tuned for more.

UPDATE: According to reports, the Oakland Raiders released P Marquette King over a “personality clash”. _______________________________________________________

While the Raiders’ decision to move on from King had plenty to do with their salary cap situation, it was his personality and on-field antics that didn’t sit well with HC Jon Gruden.
King has tallied four personal fouls over the last two seasons and it was something Gruden wanted no part of entering the new season.
King reportedly showed up to the team facility on Friday to meet the new coaching staff, but he was abruptly pulled aside by GM Reggie McKenzie and that is when he was informed of his release.
King, 29, was entering the third year of his 5-year/$16.5M contract and was due a base salary of $2.9M for the 2018 season.
The Raiders freed up $2.9M of cap space, while absorbing $150K of dead money.
King has received interest from the Minnesota Vikings, but no visits have been scheduled as of now.

NFL News: According to reports, Bills GM Brandon Beane says he is not ready to trade up for a quarterback, but mentioned that he will consider all options.
The New York Jets made an aggressive trade to acquire the No. 3 overall pick from the Indianapolis Colts on Saturday, but it came at a heavy cost.
The Jets parted ways with their No. 6 overall pick, two 2018 second-round picks (No. 37 + 49) to go along with a 2019 second-round pick.
With that being said, the Bills have been rumored to have interest in moving up for their franchise quarterback, especially considering their recent trade with the Cincinnati Bengals that netted them the 12th overall pick. In addition, the Bills possess the 22nd overall pick to go along with a total of five picks in the top-65, so they do have the draft capital to make a competitive offer to the Cleveland Browns or New York Giants for a top-2 pick.
However, while the Bills may explore the idea of a trade-up scenario, Beane is not ready to commit to it at this time. "The truth? Most of these quarterbacks I've only spent 15 minutes with. [At the combine, each team can meet with prospects for a maximum of 15 minutes per player.] I haven't spent enough time to have an opinion about any of them yet, honestly. I actually sent a little note to our [scouts] yesterday. We got six weeks to get our board together. I am not there yet, knowing if we can or will move up again. I want [head coach] Sean [McDermott] to get to know all of them. We're just keeping an open mind. Where we're at, we've got the picks, we've got the draft capital. I'm not ready to pull the trigger." The Bills acquired a 2018 third-round pick from the Cleveland Browns in exchange for Tyrod Taylor and went on to sign A.J. McCarron to a 2-year/$10M contract last week.
Stay tuned for more. ________________________________________________________

NFL News: Bills QB Tyrod Taylor says he is unwilling to restructure his contract to remain in Buffalo for the 2018 season.
Here’s what Taylor had to say when asked about the possibility of accepting a pay cut to remain with the Bills: “Definitely not part of my mindset,” Taylor said, via the Buffalo News. “I’ve done that before. I don’t think there’s a need to do that again. That’s definitely not part of my mindset.” As of now, the Bills have yet to speak with Taylor or his representatives regarding their plans for next season. “I really haven’t had any communications as to what’s the plan moving forward,” Taylor said. “I’m sure that it’ll be communicated to me at some point, but as of right now, I’m going to continue to focus on myself mentally, physically, and get ready for another season.” Taylor, 28, is set to enter the final year of his 2-year/$30.5M deal and is scheduled to become an unrestricted free-agent in 2019.
In 14 starts this season, Taylor threw for 2,799 yards, 14 touchdowns and 4 interceptions to go along with a 62.6 completion percentage. Taylor also rushed for 427 yards on 84 carries (5.1 YPC) and four touchdowns.
Taylor has posted a 22-20 record in three seasons as the Bills’ starting quarterback and led the team to the playoffs this season.

NFL News: According to reports, the Kansas City Chiefs could field trade offers for CB Marcus Peters this offseason.

NFL News: Cowboys LB Jaylon Smith says he is ready to take on a larger role in the 2018 season. "Oh man, well I played an entire season in the National Football League. I played every game, started [six] of them, improved each week," Smith said Tuesday on KRLD-FM, via the Dallas Morning News. "I feel amazing. Just the overall comfort of everything I had to go through, it was just a tremendous first year, and it's going to be a great one this year." Smith, a former 2016 second-round pick, tallied 81 tackles, which was the fourth-most on the team last season. He started the first five games of the 2017 season, but had his role diminished to give him more time to learn and develop.

Smith says his mobility in his knee has substantially improved and believes he'll continue to emerge as an impact player for the Cowboys. "It showed on the field, week by week my growth, my comfort and just being able to play the position again," he said. "I'm prepared and I'm ready to tackle even more this year. It's going to be a great year." Smith, 22, sat out the entire 2016 season as he rehabbed his way back from a gruesome knee injury he suffered during the Fiesta Bowl of his junior year. He ended up sustaining tears to his ACL and LCL and suffered nerve damage as well. Many knee specialists questioned his ability to ever play football again, but after a full year of vigorous training, Smith eventually returned to action in 2017.
Smith also recorded one sack, two forced fumbles and two pass defenses this past season.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: According to reports, Dolphins WR Jarvis Landry could be refraining from signing the franchise tag to force the team to rescind their offer.

2018 NFL Mock Draft 1.0📝

Pre-Mock Draft Notes📋: I’m assuming the New York Jets will sign QB Kirk Cousins in free agency, which could tempt the Miami Dolphins to move up into the top-10 for Baker Mayfield.
Miami has expressed interest in Mayfield early into the draft process. They met with him at the Senior Bowl and are scheduled to visit with him before his pro day on March 14th. Mayfield could be an intriguing fit in Adam Gase’s spread offense.
Quenton Nelson is regarded as the best player of this year’s draft class and could go as high as 2nd overall to the Giants. In this particular mock draft, Nelson falls into the Bears’ lap at No. 8 overall and it should be a no-brainer selection for Matt Nagy and co.
It’s also worth noting that the 49ers and Raiders, who both finished with a 6-10 regular season record, will flip a coin at the combine this week to determine who will pick 9th and 10th overall.
1. Cleveland Browns ➡️ QB Josh Allen (WYO)
2. New York Giants ➡️ RB Saquon Barkley (PSU)
3. Indianapolis Colts ➡️ DE Bradley Chubb (NCST)
4. Cleveland Browns ➡️ DB Minkah Fitzpatrick (ALA)
5. Denver Broncos ➡️ QB Josh Rosen (UCLA)
6. Miami Dolphins (Proposed Trade with NYJ) ➡️ QB Baker Mayfield (OU)
7. Tampa Bay Buccaneers ➡️ S Derwin James (FSU)
8. Chicago Bears ➡️ OG Quenton Nelson (ND)
9. San Francisco 49ers ➡️ CB Denzel Ward (OSU)
10. Oakland Raiders ➡️ LB Roquan Smith (UGA)

NFL News: Rams GM Les Snead says their focus will be to sign impending free-agents DT Aaron Donald and WR Sammy Watkins to long-term deals this offseason.
_______________________________________________________ “Every year the market changes based on last year’s (free-agent) crop signing and is there a new highest-paid player,” Snead said, via the Sporting News. “We’ll have to manage that. Also, every year we have more UFAs and decisions to make.” “But Aaron is always going to be a big part of that puzzle. We’ll always keep room in the budget for Aaron Donald and work around him.” As for free agent WR Sammy Watkins, Snead says that they’ve contacted his agent and plan to continue discussions in the coming weeks. “We’ve chatted with his agent and told him we were coming back in early February and really discuss the intricacies of our plan,” Snead said. “I know this – going from 32nd to first in offense Sammy was a big part of it down the stretch.” “A goal of ours is to keep that (wide receiver) group together because a lot of our weapons are 25 and under.” Stay tuned for more.

Here is the latest on Giants’ WR Odell Beckham Jr.
A couple of days after Giants co-owner John Mara said Beckham wasn’t “untouchable”, he has anchored down with his latest comments. “He’s not on the block,” Mara said, via Ralph Vacchiano of SNY. “Is that going to stop clubs from possibly calling us? No. But he’s not on the block. We’re not shopping him around. . . . “Do I want him to be traded? Absolutely not. I want him to be a Giant. I can’t promise that’s going to happen. We’re not looking to get rid of him, OK? I’d like him to be a Giant. But if you’re asking me for a 100 percent guarantee, nobody has that.” _______________________________________________________

The Los Angeles Rams have reportedly offered the Giants their 2018 first-round pick (No. 23 overall) for Beckham, but no trade is imminent at this time.

Injury Update: According to reports, Colts HC Frank Reich is optimistic about QB Andrew Luck (Shoulder) being cleared to throw for the start of OTA’s in April.
Luck was reportedly in Los Angeles earlier this month working with throwing specialists and the Colts are hopeful that he’ll be able to make a full recovery for the 2018 season.
Reports surfaced indicating that Luck may require an additional surgery to his throwing shoulder, but Colts GM Chris Ballard shot down those rumors at a team press conference a couple of weeks ago.
The Colts inked Luck to a 5-year/$122.97M contract extension ($87M in total guarantees) in June of 2016 that currently ranks him as the fourth highest paid quarterback in the NFL.
Luck, 28, is due to make a base salary of $12M for the 2018 season and will carry a $24.4M cap hit against the team’s pay roll.
Luck last played in the 2016 season (15 starts) and threw for 4,240 yards, 31 touchdowns and 13 interceptions to go along with a 63.5 completion percentage.

NFL News: According to reports, the Philadelphia Eagles may consider trading CB Ronald Darby this offseason.

The Eagles bolstered their secondary by acquiring Daryl Worley from the Carolina Panthers earlier today and it could lead to Darby’s departure after one season.
Philadelphia traded for Darby last August in a deal that sent Jordan Matthews and a 2018 third-round pick to the Buffalo Bills. However, Darby ended up missing most of the 2017 season after suffering a dislocated ankle in Week 1 vs. Redskins.
After several weeks of struggling to regain his conditioning, Darby finally returned to action in Week 11 vs. Cowboys.
Darby appeared in eight total games (seven starts) and recorded 34 tackles, three interceptions, and nine pass defenses.
Darby, 24, is set to enter the final year of his 4-year/$4.569M rookie contract and stands to make a base salary of $1.008M for the upcoming season.
While the Eagles aren’t fully committed to moving Darby via trade, they will certainly consider the idea as the offseason continues on.
Trading Darby will create $1.058M of cap space.

Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: Packers QB Aaron Rodgers says he hopes to play well into his 40s and realizes that he may have to do so with another team: “I think you have to be humble enough to realize if it could happen to Brett, it can happen to you,” Rodgers told the Associated Press.

Rodgers is referring to how Brett Favre departed the Packers at the age of 38 to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets and Minnesota Vikings.
Rodgers, 34, is set to enter the fourth-year of his 5-year/$110M deal and is set to make base salaries of $19.8M and $20M for the next two seasons.
Rodgers is scheduled to become an unrestricted free-agent in 2020.

NFL News: Jaguars impending free-agent WR Allen Robinson says his future in Jacksonville is uncertain and reiterated that his top priority is to get back to full health.
_______________________________________________________ "I don't really know what is going to happen. I know there's a lot of different scenarios," Robinson said. "Right now, my main focus is to kind of let my agent narrow down the scenarios and for me to get back at 100 percent. That's the main focus right now for me. Again, I know I'll be back at 100 percent and relatively soon. At the end of the day, I know all that is going to play out.” Robinson added that he is confident in his ability and knows that it will help dictate his next contract: "I know the player that I am. I know the plays that I made. I know the plays I'm going to continue to make. From that standpoint, it doesn't really bother me or I don't really concern myself too much with that [the contract situation]." Robinson, a former 2014 second-round pick, is scheduled to become an unrestricted free-agent in March and figures to be a hot commodity this offseason.
Robinson suffered a torn ACL in Week 1 vs. Texans and was placed on the season-ending Injured Reserve.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: According to reports, the New York Giants will aggressively pursue Panthers OG Andrew Norwell in free agency.
This is not the first time the Giants’ interest in Norwell has surfaced as they look to solidify their offensive line this offseason.
Norwell has obvious ties to Giants GM Dave Gettleman from his time as the Panthers’ general manager and it’s something that could sway him to New York.
Gettleman reiterated the importance of upgrading the interior of the Giants’ offensive line and how it impacts the success of the quarterback. “There isn’t a quarterback alive that’s going to get in the huddle and say, ‘OK, boys, let them up the middle. I’ll deal with it,’” Gettleman said. “You need to be firm in the middle. So at the end of the day if it’s keeping your quarterback upright and out of the hospital.” Norwell, 26, played out his one-year/$2.746M tender and is now set to hit the open market as an unrestricted free-agent.
Norwell could field offers worth up to $12M per year in free agency.
Stay tuned for more.

NFL News: Steelers RB Le’Veon Bell says he will report to the team before Week 1 of the regular season, despite his previous threat to holdout or retire if he isn’t given a long-term deal this offseason.
The Pittsburgh Steelers officially placed the franchise tag on Bell for a second consecutive offseason, which has led many to wonder if the All-Pro runner would legitimately sit out the entire 2018 season.
Here’s what Bell had to say when asked about a potential holdout: "Honestly no, I am not going to sit," he said, per The Athletic's Mark Kaboly. "I am going to be in the facility Week 1." Bell is set to earn a fully guaranteed salary of $14.544M under the franchise tender, but the 26-year-old running back is still seeking long-term security.
Bell is reportedly looking to earn a base salary of $14.5M in his next contract and the Steelers have yet to give in to that price.
While a long-term deal is uncertain for both sides, Bell has already clarified that he will play next season, regardless of what happens from here on out.
Stay tuned for more.

Many team executives fully anticipate Lewis playing elsewhere next season, considering their crowded backfield of Rex Burkhead, James White, and Mike Gillislee.
Lewis, 27, appeared in all 16 games (8 starts) this season and rushed for 896 yards on 180 attempts (5.0 YPC) and six touchdowns. In addition, Lewis hauled in 32 receptions for 214 yards receiving and three touchdowns.

NFL News: According to reports, the Cincinnati Bengals are expected to move on from impending free-agent RB Jeremy Hill this offseason.
Hill posted a farewell message to the Bengals’ organization on his twitter account saying, “Been one hell of a ride Cincinnati on to the next chapter.” Hill, 25, played out the final year of his 4-year/$3.753M rookie contract and is set to become an unrestricted free-agent in March.
Hill says he is not nervous to test the open market and believes his hard work will help him land in the right situation: “I’m not nervous at all,” Hill said. “I think the chips will fall where they may and I’m good with that going forward. I’m going to put the work in and when you do that you can sleep good at night knowing you did everything you could, and that’s what I’m going to do.” Hill appeared in seven games this season for the Bengals and rushed for 116 yards on 37 carries (3.1 YPC) to go along with four receptions for 16 yards and no touchdowns.
